issue.subject: Limitation when filtering by metadata ID
issue.description:
EasySDI is based on storing metadata ID inside it's own database.
The rights access over metadata is based on EasySDI's rules which are transform in sending CSW filter where clause based on metadata ID to Geonetwork.

Some limitation have been encountered with geonetwork when sending more than 64000 metadata ID inside CSW getRecords filter.
Removing this limitation implies that EasySDI sended filters are not based anymore on metadata ID and should be replaced by inserting EasySDI management information inside distant metadata.
Information like:
- metadata visibility
- metadata state
- metadata version
should be kept inside EasySDI mysql database (to keep on performance when managing metadata inside EasySDI interface) but should also stored inside Geonetwork metadata (to throw out this 64000 metadata constraint).
In addition, CSW Proxy should support filtering criteria per policy to allow securing metadata access from tierce OGC application.

This improvement could be thought into a global logical: why EasySDI management information must not be stored inside metadata themselves ?
